page.title: 14AMPORT & THRUXTON SCHOOLS.
page.content: There are two village Primary schools in the area, Amport & Kimpton. Amport was built in 1815 to enable the poor children of the parish to learn to read, write & come to know the Church Catechism. The school Log Books, dating from 1878, record the work of 6 Head Teachers. Kimpton was opened on the 26th April, 1966 and later dedicated by the Bishop of Winchester. It replaced schools at Thruxton and Kimpton. It has its own swimming pool. Both schools are Church Aided, under the joint control of the Diocese of Winchester & the Hampshire Education Authority. Kimpton is the larger. Tony Battye, the Headmaster, has a staff of 4.2, himself, his Deputy Head, two assistants plus a peripatetic teaching one day a week. Tom Hiscock, Amport, has a Deputy Head, Infant Teacher & a part-timer (0.2) to teach 70 children.
